intro: Decachaeta serboana, commonly known as the Serbian decachaeta, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is notable for its aromatic foliage. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
